Title: Ophthalmic statistics note 6: Effect sizes matter
Abstract: © 2015, BMJ Publishing Group. All rights reserved.The magnitude of an observed effect and the uncertainty regarding it should always be considered when interpreting statistical evidence. Whenever possible, a statistical analysis which produces an effect size estimate with associated uncertainty (eg, difference in means and its CI) rather than solely a p value should be used and reported.
